intro: Zygia huberi, commonly known as the mountain zygia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Zygia huberi is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
